item.title: 比特币反弹每天创造约 1,500 个 "百万富翁钱包
item.description: 据加密货币分析公司Kaiko Research称，比特币破纪录的涨势似乎每天都在创造约1500个新的 "百万富翁钱包"。【原文：Bitcoin’s record-breaking rally appears to be creating around 1,500 new “millionaire wallets” daily, according to crypto analytics firm Kaiko Research.】

item.title: 媒体买盘反弹，股市的杂志封面魔咒正在发挥作用
item.description: 随着 S&P 500 指数在 2023 年跃升 24% 后，在 2024 年开始时将攀升近 7%，你会认为财经媒体会呼吁谨慎对待股市还能涨多少。但事实并非如此，即使是持怀疑态度的财经出版物也在鼓励投资者买进。【原文：With the S&P 500 Index climbing almost 7% to start 2024 after jumping 24% in 2023, you’d think the financial press would be urging caution about how much further stocks can go. But that’s not happening, as even skeptical financial publications are encouraging investors to buy in.】

item.title: 康托尔起诉前银行家公司，声称数百万利润被盗
item.description: Cantor Fitzgerald LP 起诉了一家由其一批前投资银行家创办的公司，指控他们窃取了价值数百万美元的客户利润。【原文：Cantor Fitzgerald LP sued a firm launched by a group of its former investment bankers, accusing them of stealing clients worth millions of dollars in profit.】

item.title: 欧洲央行倾向于将银行最低准备金水平维持在 1
item.description: 欧洲中央银行倾向于不立即改变贷款人需要无息存放的资金数额，暂时消除了银行盈利能力受到打击的威胁。【原文：The European Central Bank is leaning against any immediate change in the amount of money lenders need to park with it interest-free, removing for now the threat of a hit to bank profitability.】

item.title: 中国从未取消过如此多的美国小麦装运
item.description: 中国又取消了一批美国小麦的出口装运，使芝加哥期货受到拖累的取消装运数量再创新高。【原文：China canceled another batch of US wheat export shipments, adding to an already record number of cancellations that have weighed on Chicago futures.】

item.title: 玻利维亚向华尔街推销与电动汽车电池金属相关的债券
item.description: 玻利维亚财政部长表示，玻利维亚正在权衡今年在纽约出售多达 10 亿美元的所谓绿色债券。【原文：Bolivia is weighing the sale of as much as $1 billion in so-called green bonds in New York this year, according to the country’s finance chief.】

item.title: BAT 称准备最快于本周启动 ITC 出售计划
item.description: 据知情人士透露，幸运牌（Lucky Strike）香烟的制造商英美烟草公司（British American Tobacco Plc）正准备最快于本周开始出售其在印度合作伙伴ITC有限公司（ITC Ltd.）的部分股份。【原文：British American Tobacco Plc, the maker of Lucky Strike cigarettes, is preparing to kick off a sale of part of its stake in Indian partner ITC Ltd. as soon as this week, people with knowledge of the matter said.】

item.title: 卢拉就红利危机传唤巴西国家石油公司首席执行官
item.description: 巴西总统路易斯-伊纳西奥-卢拉-达席尔瓦（Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva）将要求巴西国家石油公司（Petrobras）首席执行官解释其对红利危机的处理方式，该危机上周使这家国有石油公司的市值损失了 110 亿美元，他还将要求该公司解释其加快投资项目的计划，他认为这些项目对提振巴西经济至关重要。【原文：President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva will demand that Petrobras chief executive officer explains his handling of a dividends crisis that wiped out $11 billion of the state-owned oil company’s market value last week, as well its plans to accelerate investment projects he considers essential to boost Brazil’s economy.】

item.title: 埃及将重新成为新兴市场的宠儿
item.description: 埃及将重新成为海外债务投资者眼中的新兴市场宠儿，因为这个北非国家在过去两周内从经济灾难的边缘到释放了超过 500 亿美元的融资。【原文：Egypt is set for a return as an emerging-market darling for overseas debt investors, as the North African nation went from the brink of economic disaster to unlocking more than $50 billion of financing in the last two weeks.】

item.title: 战事持续，丰业银行减持以色列国防公司埃尔比特股份
item.description: 新斯科舍银行的资产管理部门减持了其在以色列国防承包商埃尔比特系统有限公司（Elbit Systems Ltd.）的股份。【原文：Bank of Nova Scotia’s asset-management arm reduced its stake in Israeli defense contractor Elbit Systems Ltd., an investment that sparked protests last year as the war between Israel and Hamas raged on.】

item.title: Blackstone 和 Apollo 在好莱坞的赌注经受了电视淡出的考验
item.description: 黑石集团 (Blackstone Inc.)、阿波罗全球管理公司 (Apollo Global Management Inc.) 和贝恩资本 (Bain Capital) 赌注数十亿美元，认为 Netflix 等服务将满足好莱坞对音效舞台的无底需求。他们即将发现自己是否错了。【原文：Blackstone Inc., Apollo Global Management Inc. and Bain Capital bet billions of dollars that services like Netflix would feed bottomless demand for Hollywood sound stages. They’re about to find out if they’re wrong.】

item.title: 据说 HitecVision 正在权衡收购英国北海石油生产商 NEO 的方案
item.description: 据知情人士透露，挪威私募股权公司HitecVision正在权衡英国油气生产商NEO能源公司的各种选择，包括可能的出售。【原文：Norwegian private equity firm HitecVision is weighing options for UK oil and gas producer NEO Energy, including a potential sale, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 阿根廷通过价值 650 亿美元的比索互换寻求喘息空间
item.description: 阿根廷将于周一开始进行创纪录的比索债务置换，以期将几乎所有 2024 年到期的债务展期至未来四年，从而为哈维尔-米莱伊总统的政府提供暂时的喘息机会。【原文：Argentina is starting a record swap of peso-denominated debt Monday in a bid to roll over almost all of its 2024 maturities into the next four years, providing a temporary respite to President Javier Milei’s government.】

item.title: 哈比卜银行首席执行官被任命为巴基斯坦新任财政部长
item.description: 巴基斯坦任命哈比卜银行（Habib Bank Ltd.）首席执行官为新任财政部长，以帮助巴基斯坦在一场有争议的选举后扶持资金短缺的经济。【原文：Pakistan appointed Habib Bank Ltd.’s chief executive officer as its new finance minister to help bolster the cash-strapped economy after a contentious election.】

item.title: 美联储终止支持美国银行的工具，使储备金成为关注焦点
item.description: 随着帮助解决去年地区银行危机的紧急贷款工具到期，华尔街银行正在寻找其他方法来充实自己的资金。【原文：Wall Street banks are hunting for alternative ways to shore up their coffers as an emergency lending tool that helped resolve last year’s regional banking crisis expires.】

item.title: 巴西种植者破产，70 亿美元农业信贷热潮受挫
item.description: 农业强国巴西正在收获一个又一个丰收。然而，种植者却以惊人的速度破产，这给这个快速增长的 70 亿美元农业企业融资市场的投资者带来了打击。【原文：Agricultural powerhouse Brazil is harvesting one bumper crop after another. Yet, growers are going bankrupt at an alarming rate, dealing a blow to investors in the fast-growing $7 billion market for agribusiness funding.】

item.title: Signa Prime 即将与 Schoeller 集团达成奥地利资产出售协议
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Signa 旗舰地产部门即将达成协议，向德国 Schoeller 集团出售奥地利的豪华资产组合。【原文：Signa’s flagship property unit is close to an agreement to sell a portfolio of luxury Austrian assets to Germany’s Schoeller Group, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 汽车贷款投诉冲击银行，而银行甚至不属于英国评论网
item.description: 一家次级贷款机构因客户对汽车贷款的投诉激增而受到打击；尽管该银行表示，它并不是英国正在进行的汽车贷款行为审查的对象。【原文：A subprime lender has been hit by a spike in customer complaints over car loans — even though the bank said it’s not a subject of the ongoing UK review into auto lending practices.】

item.title: 辛杜贾律师称人口贩运起诉书存在缺陷
item.description: 亿万富翁欣杜贾家族的成员因虐待其家政人员而被控贩卖人口，他们说瑞士对他们的起诉书漏洞百出，必须退回检察官重新审查。【原文：Members of the billionaire Hinduja family charged with human trafficking over the mistreatment of their domestic staff said that the Swiss indictment against them is deeply flawed and must be sent back to prosecutors for re-examination.】

item.title: 银行家富豪的律师被指对其现金审查过于客气
item.description: 一家顶级律师事务所被指控违反了英国的洗钱规定，因为该事务所过于礼貌，没有询问一位来自前苏联共和国、与政治有关联的银行家是如何获得现金的。【原文：A top law firm is accused of breaking UK money-laundering rules by being too polite to ask a politically connected banker from a former Soviet republic how he got his cash.】

item.title: 美国之行凸显制裁困境，德国莱弗森银行股价暴跌
item.description: 就在 Raiffeisen Bank International AG 试图敲定一项涉及其俄罗斯部门的复杂交易时，该奥地利贷款机构受到了一名美国高级制裁官员的访问，此后其在维也纳的股价最高下跌了 12%。【原文：Shares of Raiffeisen Bank International AG fell as much as 12% in Vienna after the Austrian lender was visited by a senior US sanctions official just as it seeks to finalize a complex deal involving its Russian unit.】
